notes: IMPORTANT: dpi MUST match your printer's HARDWARE DPI!
Most thermal printers are 203 DPI (8 dots/mm)
Budget/older printers may be 100, 150, or 180 DPI
To test: Print 80mm, measure actual width, adjust dpi if wrong
chunk_data: true = split into 16KB chunks (reliable), false = send all at once (faster)
Disable chunking for printers that handle large transfers well
vendor_id and product_id use DECIMAL format (not hex)
Set product_id to null to match any product from that vendor
To find your printer's VID/PID: Check /status API endpoint
CASH DRAWER STATUS MAPPING (optional, only for non-standard printers):
- drawer_bit: Which bit changes when drawer opens/closes (0-7)
- inverted: true = bit 0 means OPEN, bit 1 means CLOSED
- required_bits: Optional pattern matching (e.g., bit4 must be 1)
